plugins.name: Stray Component & Variable Finder (Ghost, Unindexed, Orphaned, Etc.)
plugins.description:
What is this plugin good for?


This plugin makes it easy to identify ‚Äòstray‚Äô component or variables within a design file.


What is a ‚Äòstray' component/variable

A stray component or variable is one that either:

(1) is no longer properly linked to its original library (because the library was removed or changed), or

(2) was left behind from a previous library you no longer want to use.


Figma often identifies these in your assets panel as libraries that are ‚Äòused in this file‚Äô but they does not give you any indication of WHERE in the file they are being used. This plugin makes it easy to identify these components.


ñ®†ñ®†ñ®† If you find this plugin useful, and you feel like it, throw me some coffee dollars. ñ®†ñ®†ñ®†


How do I use this plugin?


1. Identify libraries you want to keep.

Start by opening the file where you want to find and fix stray components or variables. In the Assets panel, review the libraries that are currently being used in the file.


2. Index the libraries you don't want flagged as stray.

Open the plugin inside each library file you want to keep.

In the Library Manager tab, click "Index Library" for each one.

This ensures that components and variables from these libraries won't be flagged as stray later.


3. Return to your target file and run a scan.

Go back to your target file. In the plugin, open the "Scan Components/Variables" tab and choose whether you want to scan for components or variables.

The plugin will search your file for anything not included in your indexed libraries.


4. Review the results.

You'll see a list of all stray components or variables it found, along with helpful details like node names and their location in the file.





More Specific FAQ Questions‚Ä®


What is the difference between Variable View and Node View for variables?


Variable View:

Organizes the scan results by each specific stray variable.

You can see all the places across your file where a particular stray variable appears.


Node View:

Organizes the scan results by the nodes that have the most stray variables.

This helps you prioritize fixing nodes with the highest number of issues, regardless of the variable types.


The scan is identifying components that belong to one of my indexed libraries as a Stray, what‚Äôs going on?


The most likely answer is that the component was deleted from the library. When this happens the component in the target file will point to its original library but does not actually exist there any longer (and therefore was not indexed)


Why can‚Äôt the plugin identify the library the stray component/variable comes from?


The Figma Plugin API does not expose data about files you own or have access to, so there is no way to get this information without adding an Authentication flow


Why can‚Äôt the plugin display the name of each variable in the results list?


Similar to the answer above, the Plugin API cannot get the name of variables from files that it does not have access to. It can only access the local name of the variable which tends to be semantically meaningless. Sorry.


Can I scan for both components and variables at the same time?


No, you‚Äôll need to run the scan separately for components and variables. Maybe this could come in a future update.


Do I need to re-index libraries if they change?


Yes. If you update a library (e.g. delete or rename components/variables), it's a good idea to re-open that file and click ‚ÄúIndex Library‚Äù again to make sure your scan stays accurate.


How long does the scan take?


The indexing and scanning process should be relatively quick (~3 to 30 seconds) generally; however the processing time is related to how big of a file you are scanning.
plugins.tagline: Search find and fix unused, orphaned, or unindexed library components & variables in your file

plugins.name: Font Replacer - Compact
plugins.description:
üìù Description

Transform your text styles in seconds! The fastest way to batch update font styles in Figma with minimal effort.


‚ú® Key Features

- One-click batch replacement for multiple text layers

- Lightning-fast font style updates

- Real-time font preview with instant search

- Auto-detect and display mixed text styles

- Seamless dark mode support

- Clean, minimal interface for maximum efficiency


üöÄ Quick Start

1. Select text layers or frames

2. Pick your font settings

3. Click update - Done!


‚ö†Ô∏è Notes

- Ensure target fonts are installed in Figma

- Font names are case-sensitive

- Plugin automatically adapts to Figma's theme


üîß Troubleshooting

Common issues and quick fixes:

- Font not updating? ‚Üí Check if font is installed

- Text not changing? ‚Üí Ensure layers are unlocked

- Nothing selected? ‚Üí Select text layers first


If you have any suggestions, please feel free to let me know, thanks ‚ù§

Contact: kingyo@live.com
plugins.tagline: A super efficient Figma plugin for replacing text styles with minimal clicks.

This plugin can help you:


Convert frame names into editable text layers.

Enhance your design workflow and ensure your exports are clear and informative!

Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºö‰∏∫‰øùËØÅÊÄßËÉΩÔºåÊ≠§ÂäüËÉΩÂú®ÊÇ®ÂÅúÊ≠¢Êìç‰ΩúÂêéÊúâÁü≠ÊöÇÂª∂Êó∂ÔºåÁ∫¶200ÊØ´Áßí„ÄÇ

Êèí‰ª∂‰ºöËá™Âä®‚ÄúËÆ∞‰Ωè‚ÄùÊÇ®ÂØπÊØè‰∏™ÂõæÂ±ÇÂ∫îÁî®ÁöÑÂèÇÊï∞„ÄÇÂΩìÊÇ®‰∏ãÊ¨°ÈÄâ‰∏≠Âêå‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂõæÂ±ÇÊó∂ÔºåÊèí‰ª∂‰ºöËá™Âä®Âä†ËΩΩ‰∏äÊ¨°ÁöÑËÆæÁΩÆÔºåÊñπ‰æøÊÇ®ËøõË°åÂæÆË∞É„ÄÇ


Liquid Distortion Plugin Instructions


  1. Add an image background in a Figma Frame, then create or select a rectangle or circle layer (currently only supports rectangles and circles).
  2. Open this plugin, and you will immediately see a preliminary effect in the preview window at the top.
  3. Adjust the parameters below to customize the glass texture you want.
  4. Click Place to apply the final effect to your layer.


Parameter Details

  1. Clarity

1x, 2x, 3x: Controls the resolution of the generated effect image. The higher the multiplier, the clearer the image, but the generation speed will be slightly slower. 2x is recommended for the best balance.

  1. Distortion Range

Controls the size of the clear area at the center of the glass. The lower the value, the larger the clear area, with distortion effects only appearing at the edges; the higher the value, the smaller the clear area, causing the distortion effect to contract toward the center.

  1. Distortion Strength

Controls the intensity of the edge distortion. The higher the value, the stronger the lens stretching effect at the edges.

  1. Gaussian Blur

Add a layer of background blur to the entire glass effect to simulate the texture of frosted glass.

  1. Chromatic Aberration

Add subtle red/blue color separation to distorted edges to simulate the optical chromatic dispersion of real lenses, enhancing realism.


Additional Features

  1. iOS Style

When checked, it will automatically add iOS system control effects to your layer. This effect will not override your existing strokes or other styles.

  1. Live Insert

Once checked, any modifications you make to parameters in the plugin, as well as any movement or scaling of layers in Figma, will be updated in real-time and automatically applied to the layers, achieving a WYSIWYG effect.

Note: To ensure performance, this feature has a brief delay of about 200 milliseconds after you stop operating.

  1. Parameter Memory Function

The plugin will automatically "remember" the parameters you applied to each layer. When you select the same layer next time, the plugin will automatically load the previous settings, making it easier for you to fine-tune.

Liquid Distortion Plugin Instructions


  1. Add an image background in a Figma Frame, then create or select a rectangle or circle layer (currently only supports rectangles and circles).
  2. Open this plugin, and you will immediately see a preliminary effect in the preview window at the top.
  3. Adjust the parameters below to customize the glass texture you want.
  4. Click Place to apply the final effect to your layer.


Parameter Details

  1. Clarity

1x, 2x, 3x: Controls the resolution of the generated effect image. The higher the multiplier, the clearer the image, but the generation speed will be slightly slower. 2x is recommended for the best balance.

  1. Distortion Range

Controls the size of the clear area at the center of the glass. The lower the value, the larger the clear area, with distortion effects only appearing at the edges; the higher the value, the smaller the clear area, causing the distortion effect to contract toward the center.

  1. Distortion Strength

Controls the intensity of the edge distortion. The higher the value, the stronger the lens stretching effect at the edges.

  1. Gaussian Blur

Add a layer of background blur to the entire glass effect to simulate the texture of frosted glass.

  1. Chromatic Aberration

Add subtle red/blue color separation to distorted edges to simulate the optical chromatic dispersion of real lenses, enhancing realism.


Additional Features

  1. iOS Style

When checked, it will automatically add iOS system control effects to your layer. This effect will not override your existing strokes or other styles.

  1. Live Insert

Once checked, any modifications you make to parameters in the plugin, as well as any movement or scaling of layers in Figma, will be updated in real-time and automatically applied to the layers, achieving a WYSIWYG effect.

Note: To ensure performance, this feature has a brief delay of about 200 milliseconds after you stop operating.

  1. Parameter Memory Function

The plugin will automatically "remember" the parameters you applied to each layer. When you select the same layer next time, the plugin will automatically load the previous settings, making it easier for you to fine-tune.

plugins.name: FigTextExporter
plugins.description:
# FigText Exporter: AI-Powered Translation Export Plugin for Figma


Transform your Figma text layers into translation-ready JSON files instantly with FigText - the smart localization assistant for designers and developers.


## Key Features


- *Automatic Text Detection:* Scans your Figma files and identifies all text layers that need translation

- *Smart JSON Generation:* Creates structured JSON translation files with nested keys based on your design hierarchy

- *Multi-Language Support:* Export translation files for multiple languages simultaneously

- *Context Preservation:* Maintains the original context of text elements for more accurate translations


## Benefits


- *Time Savings:* Convert hours of manual work into seconds of automated processing

- *Improved Workflow:* Seamlessly integrate with your development pipeline

- *Error Prevention:* Reduce human error in translation file creation

- *Team Efficiency:* Perfect for small teams looking to streamline their localization process


üöÄ Stop spending valuable time on manual translation file creation. Let FigText handle the tedious work while you focus on what matters most - creating amazing designs.


## How It Works


1. Select your text layers in Figma

2. Run FigText plugin

3. Choose your target languages

4. Get your translation-ready JSON files instantly


Perfect for developers and designers who want to maintain productivity without getting bogged down by repetitive localization tasks.
plugins.tagline: Easily export and translate text from figma projects

plugins.name: Thumb Zone AI
plugins.description:
The Thumb Zone plugin enables you to add your frames to the platform and test it with your users. This plugin can be used for mobile UIs and allows you to perform various types of tests such as UI audit, predicting user behavior, conducting tests with synthetic users, as well as testing with real users to study their emotions.


To add a file from Thumb Zone to Figma, follow the steps below:


  1. Install the plugin.
  2. Define a new product in Thumb Zone.
  3. Select the "Import from Figma" option in Thumb Zone.
  4. Generate a token.
  5. Enter the received token in the Figma plugin.
  6. Select the frames.
  7. Sync!


Frames are synced to Thumb Zone screens, build and test your flow!


Visit https://thumbzone.ai to create your account.

accepted.description: AI copilot for mobile user testing

plugins.name: BizTag - Name Tag Generator
plugins.description:
Automating the name tag design process


Conferences, case comps, and hackathons make up the highlights of many student's time in universities. Why? Because they combine hands-on learning, creativity, teamwork, networking, and the thrill of solving real-world challenges in a lively, collaborative environment.


If you've ever attended one of these events, you might notice that professional partners have name tags around their neck. Designing these name tags can take hours of manual work to make the layouts consistent and audit for content mistakes. But what if all that work could be done with the click of a button?


Meet BizTag


BizTag is a powerful Figma plugin that is built by a designer, for designers. The app communicates with Figma's Plugin API to build a series of clean, customizable, and organized name tags.


All it takes is a background image with a resolution of your choosing, and a .csv file populated with information on your event partners, and you can generate dozens of name tags instantly. The plugin automatically places name, company, and pronouns on the frontside, and generates a QR code to place on the backside using a QR code API.


Each frame comes with auto layout, enabling ease of customizability for the designer.


Schema


The schema is as follows:


type Partner = {
firstname: string;
lastname: string;
position: string; // Position @ Company
pronouns: string; // etc. They / Them
linkedin: string; // LinkedIn Profile URL
};

type PartnerList = Partner[];


where the .json / .csv file is taken as a single PartnerList object.
plugins.tagline: Automate your graphic design process

plugins.name: IconPilot
plugins.description:
üöÄ IconPilot: The Ultimate Icon Management Plugin for Your Design System!


Say goodbye to hours of manual work prepping icons for your design system. IconPilot simplifies converting your individual stroke and outline icons into fully customizable multi-variant components in seconds, streamlining your workflow and maintaining consistency across your design system.


‚ú® Key Use Cases:

  1. Quickly convert hundreds of stroke or outline icons into organized multi-variant components.
  2. Define custom sizes, stroke widths, and colors once‚Äîthen apply effortlessly across your entire icon set.
  3. Maintain design consistency using Figma variables to automatically sync icon properties.


üîß Seamless Workflow:

  1. Select your icons (components or frames).
  2. Set variant names, sizes, stroke widths, and colors (raw values or Figma variables).
  3. Click convert‚ÄîIconPilot instantly generates neatly organized icon components ready for your design system.


üí° Powerful Features:

  1. Bulk convert from single icons to thousands at once.
  2. Intelligent Figma variables filtering‚Äîonly relevant variables appear for size, stroke, or color fields.
  3. Auto-generated search-friendly descriptions to effortlessly find icons in assets.
  4. Persistent configurations‚Äîset once, reuse endlessly within your file.

plugins.name: Text Style Capture - FREE Copy and Paste
plugins.description:
Beta 0.1

Hi there! I built this plugin to solve a problem I face every day: transferring text styles between Figma files.

This simple solution helps you quickly capture text styles from one file and paste them into another, maintaining all the original properties. No more recreating styles from scratch or dealing with inconsistencies!

It's still in early beta (version 0.1), but it already saves me tons of time, and I hope it helps you too.

Key features:


One-click text style capture

Select which styles to transfer

Persistent storage between sessions

Clean, modern interface


I'd love to hear your feedback! If you encounter any bugs or have suggestions for improvements, please let me know. I'm actively working on making this plugin better.

If you find this helpful and want to support further development, you can buy me a coffee.

Thanks for trying it out!

HypoGen is a Figma plugin designed to streamline hypothesis generation, making it easy for designers and product teams to turn ideas into clear, testable statements. ‚Ä¢Guided Input Fields: Fill in prompts that help you clarify the problem, proposed solution, and expected impact.

‚Ä¢Instant Hypothesis Notes: Generate neatly formatted hypotheses directly on your Figma canvas, keeping ideas accessible and organized within your design environment.

‚Ä¢Consistent Structure: Follow a standardized hypothesis framework, ensuring your team‚Äôs testing approach is clear, goal-oriented, and easy to measure.


What You‚Äôll Learn:

‚Ä¢Hypothesis-Driven Design Thinking: Incorporate hypothesis-based thinking into your design process, empowering you to test assumptions and make data-informed decisions with confidence.

Make your design decisions testable with HypoGen‚Äîcreate hypotheses effortlessly and start building with purpose.

plugins.name: Winding Rule Inspector
plugins.description:
Warning: If you don't know what Winding Rules are, you probably don't need this plugin.


If you want to know more about winding rules, follow this link: https://oreillymedia.github.io/Using_SVG/extras/ch06-fill-rule.html


This plugin allows designers to quickly inspect the winding rule of vector objects in Figma. It provides instant feedback about the selected vector's winding rule, helping you understand and manage the rendering behavior of complex vector shapes.


Key features:

- Automatically displays the winding rule of the selected vector object

- Updates in real-time as you select different vector objects

- Provides clear notifications for non-vector selections or when no object is selected

- Runs unobtrusively in the background, allowing you to continue your design work


How to use:

1. Run the plugin

2. Select any vector object in your Figma design

3. A notification will appear showing the winding rule of the selected vector

4. As you select different vector objects, the notification will update automatically


This tool is perfect for designers working with complex vector illustrations, icons, or any projects where precise control over vector rendering is crucial. Understanding the winding rule can help resolve unexpected rendering issues and ensure your vectors display correctly across different platforms and use cases.


Note: This plugin only works with vector objects. Selecting any other type of object will result in a notification indicating that the selected object is not a vector.

accepted.name: Thierry

plugins.tagline: This plugin allows designers to quickly inspect the winding rule of vector objects in Figma.

With this plugin, designs can be:

‚Ä¢Seamlessly transformed

‚Ä¢Directly deployed into enterprise platforms like Unqork,

plugins.name: Oz Words
plugins.description:
Introducing Oz Words, the powerful content design plugin for Figma that streamlines your workflow and simplifies your development process.


How to use


  1. Rename the layer's name of your text by starting with "#t." and then follow with words. For example, "#t.back" or "#t.page_a.title"
  2. Open Oz Words Plugin, go to the library of the language you want to edit
  3. Look for the word you want to edit in code, edit and click save
  4. After saving, your text will update automatically


Note

This is our Beta version to test our concept. Please follow us for more updates. We are working on a simpler and user-friendly version and hope it will come out soon. Cheers!
plugins.tagline: With Oz Words, you can create text as components that can be edited and updated with just one click.

plugins.name: FrameSwapper | Frame to Component
plugins.description:
‚ú®Overview

FrameSwapper is a powerful Figma plugin that helps you replace multiple frames with the same name with a selected component. Perfect for design system implementation and large-scale design updates.


‚ú® Key Features

  1. üîç Smart frame detection: Automatically finds all frames with the same name
  2. üñºÔ∏è Visual preview: Shows thumbnails of both frames and components
  3. ‚ö° Batch replacement: Replace multiple frames at once
  4. üé® Component integrity: Maintains original component dimensions and properties
  5. üîé Search functionality: Quickly find components by name
  6. üì± Clean UI: Modern, intuitive interface


üõ†Ô∏è How It Works

  1. Select any frame in your design
  2. Click "Find Matching Frames" to detect similar frames
  3. Choose which frames to replace (or use "Select All")
  4. Pick a component from the available list
  5. Click "Replace" to transform your frames


üí° Use Cases

  1. Implementing design system components across multiple frames
  2. Updating old designs with new component versions
  3. Standardizing repeated elements across your design
  4. Converting prototype frames into component instances


üÜï Version 1.0.0 Updates

  1. Initial release with core functionality
  2. Smart component replacement system
  3. Visual preview system
  4. Search and filter capabilities
  5. Batch selection and replacement
  6. Modern, user-friendly interface


üí°Resources & Links

üìù [Feedback Form](https://forms.gle/goMQSobvFav6Unjy9)
